Post-Match Reflections: Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said the team felt like they had winnable games.
Ryan Mountcastle said it's tough to swallow the team sliding so far from July on.
First baseman Ryan Mountcastle had no answers for how the team dipped in runs per game, slugging percentage, OPS, and every other tangible metric as the season wore on.
Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said the team had opportunities to win, but the next two games got out of hand.
The Orioles scored one run the entire series, running the organization's playoff losing streak to 10 in the process.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles were 20 games over.500 in the first half of the season.
The team had World Series expectations.
The Orioles' offense took a nosedive in August and September after Jordan Westburg fractured his hand.
Catcher Adley Rutschman went the better part of four months as a below-average offensive player.
The Orioles were a.500 team in the second half of the season.
The team acquired Zach Eflin at the trade deadline, but it may not have been enough to change the outcome.
The Orioles front office has been criticized for playing it safe at the trade deadline.
The team needs to find answers for their struggles, especially with key players like Corbin Burnes and Anthony Santander leaving the team.
The Orioles have a talented young team, but they need to make aggressive moves to upgrade and not waste another year of their young core.
Others: The Orioles will be under new ownership led by David Rubenstein, who will take a close look at the business in the first full offseason.
The team's front office needs to learn from its mistakes and figure out how to take the next step after a disappointing playoff loss.
The Orioles' window of opportunity is here, and they need to act quickly to make upgrades and not let it slam shut sooner than expected.
The team's lack of experience and veteran presence was a major factor in their playoff loss.
The Orioles need to find ways to upgrade their roster and make bold moves to stay competitive in the future.
